paper_abstract: All-optical frequency shift keying (FSK)-WDM to intensity modulation (IM)-optical TDM (OTDM) transmultiplexing conversion by using a Mach- Zehnder interferometer wavelength converter is reported for an integrated access metro network scenario. The WDM tributary signals are generated by direct FSK modulation on a grating coupler sampled reflector tunable laser. The resultant IM-OTDM signal is up to 20 times faster than with the tributary channels and is stable and tolerant to channel interference. All-optical demultiplexing has also been validated. (C) 2006 Optical Society of America.
paper_title: All-optical FSK-WDM to intensity modulation-OTDM transmultiplexing for access passive optical networks
